author: nashatyrev
content:
That topic may become even more interesting in the light of upcoming Merge. 

On the beacon mainnet my peer (without validators) had about 47 of 50 connected peers with subnet subscriptions, meaning that the current beacon main net is mostly validator nodes (47 of 50 was just a single snapshot and is not pretending to be a statistics)
After the merge the proportion of validator and non-validator nodes would most likely significantly change in favor of non-validator nodes. (should we expect just 20% or 5% of all nodes would be validating?)

Would validating nodes become eagerer for other validating nodes to be connected to? (because it would probably be harder to find and connect to nodes with subnets)
Would it significantly change network topology? (e.g. would it naturally form validator and non-validator subnets weakly connected?)
Does it probably make sense to obligate non-validator nodes to persist on at least 1 subnet?

content: How can you force a non-validating node to do anything?

content: I suppose if all clients don't take peers that aren't subscribed that would naturally lead to that situation
